page.title: 07ABERGELE HIGH SCHOOL
page.content: Ysgol Emrys ap Iwan was formed in 1967 by the amalgamation of Abergele Grammar school and Dinorben Secondary Modern school. The name is that of a local 19th Century man of letters. At that time the school's population was 670 but it now exceeds 1200. The present head, Mr. G. Newman, has recently been appointed to an Inspectoral/Advisory role in the Coventry Authority. Pupils may leave at 16 years of age but may stay on in the 6th form and proceed to University Polytchnics and other colleges. The catchment area covers not only Abergele but also the surrounding villages including Rhuddlan. Recently the broad curriculum was enlarged further by the inclusion of the School in the Manpower services commission's Technical Vocational Education Initiative (TVEI) scheme.
